champ.champInfo:
The general management of the organization and conduct of competitions is carried out by the Department of Youth and Sports of the Lutsk City Council. Direct management is entrusted to the main panel of judges and the NGO "KORDON Children's Sports Club". The main judge of the competition is Bohdan Serhiyovych Mandrykin (Lutsk). The deputy chief judge is Ihor Rostislavovych Girskyi (Lutsk). The secretary of the competition is Hlushchuk Taras Oleksiyovych (Lutsk). Judging of competitions is conducted in accordance with the standards and rules of the International Kyokushinkai Karate Organization (5 judges, flag signaling). Referees must wear black pants, a blue shirt and a white (yellow) bow tie, a personal whistle. The organizers of the competition, the panel of judges, and other officials of the competition are not responsible for accidents and injuries that may occur during the matches.

The competition will be held on May 5-6, 2023 in the city of Lutsk "Children's and Youth Sports School No. 3 of the Lutsk City Council", str. Hlushets, 20

Competition organizing committee: GO "Sports Club KORDON"

E-mail:

Bohdan MANDRYKIN phone: +38 096-383-78-72

Program

May 5, 2023

  • 10.00-12.00 - arrival of the teams. pre-weighing
  • 13.30-16.00 - weighing of participants, mandate committee.
  • 16.30-18.30 – judges' seminar
  • 19.00-20.00 - drawing of lots

May 6, 2023

  • 09.00-09.30 – ceremonial opening of the competition
  • 09.30-12.30 - qualifying matches in the "kumite" section
  • 13.30-15.00 - qualifying matches in the "kumite" section
  • 15.30-17.00 - the beginning of the final part of the competition
  • 17.00-18.00 – end of competition, awarding of winners and prize-winners

Competition participants

Athletes, members of national kyokushinkai karate teams of sports organizations (federations, associations, clubs, etc.) that are members of the NFKKU, as well as invited teams of sports organizations of Ukraine from other types of full-contact karate participate in the competitions. Competitors must have a qualification degree of no less than 8 kyu (series A), no higher than 9 kyu (series B). Male and female participants compete in separate sections of the competition. Participants compete in sports uniforms and mandatory personal protectors, in accordance with the Rules of kyokushinkai karate competitions in force in Ukraine.

Tournament rules

In accordance with the Regulation on the procedure for the preparation of sports facilities and other specially designated places for mass sports and cultural and entertainment events, approved by the Resolution of the Cabinet of Ministers of Ukraine dated December 18, 1998 No. 2025, the preparation and proper technical condition of sports facilities is entrusted to their owners.

The nature of the competition

  • Competitions are held separately for male and female participants
  • Qualification level: series "A" (0-9 kyu), series "B" (8 kyu and older)
  • The method of competition is Olympic/circular

KUMITE categories

Men

  • 2005-2006: -60; -65; -70; -75; -80; +80
  • 2007-2008: -50; -55; -60; -65; -70; -75; +75
  • 2009-2010: -35; -40; -45; -50; -55; -60; -65; +65
  • 2011-2012: -30; -35; -40; -45; -50; -55; +55
  • 2013-2014: -25; -30; -35; -40; -45; -50; +50
  • 2015-2016: -20; -25; -30; -35; -40; -45; +45

Women

  • 2005-2006: -50; -55; -60; -65; +65
  • 2007-2008: -50; -55; -60; -65; +65
  • 2009-2010: -35; -40; -45; -50; -55; -60; -65; +65
  • 2011-2012: -30; -35; -40; -45; -50; -55; +55
  • 2013-2014: -25; -30; -35; -40; -45; -50; +50
  • 2015-2016: -20; -25; -30; -35; -40; -45; +45

Conducting matches and duration of matches.

2009-2016

  • qualifying matches: 1.0 min., 1.0 min.
  • semifinal/final: 1.0 min., 1.0 min., 1.0 min.

2005-2008

  • qualifying matches: 1.5 min., 1.5 min.
  • semifinal/final: 1.5 min., 1.5 min., 1.5 min.

The organizing committee can make the following changes to the provisions of these competitions:

  • merge or add weight and age categories
  • hold competitions in specified weight categories in a round-robin fashion

Rewarding

Athletes who took 1-3 places are awarded with cups, diplomas and medals of the respective degrees.
